intro: Miquelia pallens, commonly known as the white-flowered miquelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lecythidaceae and is characterized by its showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
